item.title: Grieving family say health staff ignored warning signs before son's death
item.description:
Warning: This story contains distressing content that involves suicide.
A grieving foster father says staff ignored crucial warning signs before his son's suspected suicide at an acute mental health ...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

enclosure.url: https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202021/tamakiheke3_70x70.png?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Tamaki Heke, 24, was diagnosed with fetal alcohol spectrum disorder and had been in and out of inpatient mental health care. Photo / Supplied

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202021/tamakiheke2_70x70.png?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Tamaki Heke, 24, was described as personable and warm, talented and creative. Photo / Supplied
